definition: sorption (generic term for absorption, adsorption, diffusion, precipitation etc)
to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: How long must the iron-hearted monster feed on our life's blood?
sentences.chinese: 这铁石心肠的怪物吸着我们的血液，还得吸多久呢？

sentences.english: A similar trend of variation in sorption coefficients was observed.
sentences.chinese: 水溶性有机物的吸着系数也呈同样的递变趋势。

sentences.english: He sniffled, and I knew he caught cold.
sentences.chinese: 他吸着鼻子说话，我才知道他感冒了。

sentences.english: By( such powerful preposition) her deep inhale, the little firelight got flickering.
sentences.chinese: 深吸着，让那小火光闪了闪。

sentences.english: He had a pipe in his mouth and was smoking.
sentences.chinese: 他嘴里衔一个烟斗，正吸着烟。

sentences.english: Elsewhere in the cafe, men smoked and sipped tea and coffee.
sentences.chinese: 在咖啡屋的其他地方，人们吸着烟，喝着茶和咖啡。

sentences.english: One man lighted a crack pipe, inhaling deeply.
sentences.chinese: 一名男子点燃皱巴巴的香烟，深深地吸着。

sentences.english: And he stepped outside to inhale the cooling, horse-scented air.
sentences.chinese: 然后他跨出门外大口吸着凉爽的充满马味的空气。

sentences.english: She breathed deeply to fill her lungs with the fresh sea air.
sentences.chinese: 她深深地吸着气，以便让海边的清新空气透入心肺。

sentences.english: He pulled at his pipe and stared at the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他深深地吸着烟斗，并凝视着炉火。

sentences.english: Sorption saturation point (SSP) was the critical moisture content for hygroscopic deformation of RSPB.
sentences.chinese: 吸着饱和点SSP是刨花板吸湿变形的临界含水率。

sentences.english: They took turns sipping sugar water.
A similar trend of variation in sorption coefficients w…
sentences.chinese: 水溶性有机物的吸着系数也呈同样的递变趋势。

sentences.english: He puffed away at a cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 他一口一口地吸着香烟。

sentences.english: And I see two nurses, ladies, having a cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 后来我看到两个护士，女士，吸着烟。

definition: to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale
big mouthful (of food, drink, smoke etc)/open mouth/gulping/gobbling/gaping
to sip/to smack one's lips/to taste/to savor
(onom.) patter, splatter, click/to smack one's lips/to pull (on a pipe)
to swallow clouds and blow out fog (idiom)/to blow cigarette or opium smoke
